common_issues.title: Pieces Software Bugs and LLM Code Generation Issues
common_issues.description: Users report issues with Pieces software, including the CLI's LTM feature not working, the VS Code extension's copy button endlessly loading, and LLMs not providing complete or correct code.  Further investigation is needed to identify the root causes and solutions for these diverse problems. Sharing logs, code snippets, and reproduction steps would be helpful.

common_issues.title: Pieces performance issues and crashes across platforms
common_issues.description: Users report performance issues like slowdowns and crashes with Pieces Desktop and OS on macOS and Windows.  macOS users experience high CPU usage and fan speeds. Windows users report crashes, especially with Chrome tabs containing large amounts of content.  Additional issues reported with LTM not working correctly in the Pieces CLI. Troubleshooting steps include checking system resources, updating Pieces to the latest version, and reviewing logs for errors.

related_issues.title: Long Term Memory 2 stills slow down my macbook pro with intel chipset.
related_issues.text: Long Term Memory 2 stills slow down my macbook pro with intel chipset. ### Checked for Existing Issues? - [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this. ### Software Desktop Application ### Operating System / Platform macOS ### Your Pieces OS Version 11.3.6 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. When i run pieces desktop app and pieces os. My macbook pro fan starts at the top speed which results to slows down my pc. I will add some details related to my macbook and pieces version with some screen shots. **Mac details -** Processor - 2.2 GHz Quad-Core Intel Core i7 Graphics - Intel Iris Pro 1536 MB Memory - 16 GB 1600 MHz DDR3 MacOS - 15.5 (24F74) Pieces Desktop version - 4.1.2 Pieces OS - 11.3.6 **Images for CPU and GPU Usage** Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

related_issues.title: Pieces crash when on Chrome tab with a lot of content
related_issues.text:
Pieces crash when on Chrome tab with a lot of content
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.4.0

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

1. Start Pieces OS and Pieces for Developers and use them as normal.
2. Open a tab with a large amount of content. In my case, it was a GitLab CI job with a 6k line job log. I also experienced crashes with ArgoCD when having 100+ apps on a page.
3. Both Pieces OS and Pieces for Developers crash. There are no corresponding log records in the Support directory, only logs about application startup.

Sometimes it freezes Chrome completely.

I have 16GB RAM, 12 vCPU, and have never experienced such behavior without Pieces.
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

common_issues.title: Pieces performance and usability issues across platforms
common_issues.description: Users reported inverted arrow key scrolling in Copilot chat on macOS (4.1.2), crashes on Windows (11.4.0) when Chrome tabs have extensive content (e.g., large logs), and high CPU/GPU usage with slow performance on macOS (11.3.6/4.1.2) potentially related to Long Term Memory 2.  Further investigation is needed to identify the root causes and solutions for these distinct issues across different operating systems and Pieces versions.

related_issues.title: Arrow keys inverted when scrolling through Copilot conversation
related_issues.text:
Arrow keys inverted when scrolling through Copilot conversation
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

4.1.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Arrow keyboard input for up and down keys is inverted when using the keyboard to scroll through a Pieces Copilot conversation.

Steps to reproduce:

- Open Pieces Desktop (4.1.2 macOS in my case)
- Make sure to open Pieces Copilot view
- Open a conversation that's long enough to have overflow content in the chat window
- Click on the chat window or input box to make sure the focus is on the conversation (and not focused on the left-side conversation list)
- Use the up and down arrow keys to scroll through the conversation content.

Expected behaviour: Actually I'm a lifelong flight simulator gamer so I really don't mind the actual behaviour I'm getting, but I imagine the expected behaviour would be for down key to scroll down through the content and up key to scroll up.

Actual behaviour: Y-axis is inverted. I have to press up to scroll down through a conversation, and down key to scroll up.
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

common_issues.title: Pieces crashes/freezes or features malfunction on Windows
common_issues.description: Multiple users on Windows report Pieces crashing or freezing, especially with the desktop app and VS Code extension.  One user experienced crashes with large content in Chrome tabs, while others reported issues with the copy button and LTM functionality in the CLI. Issues appear across different Pieces versions (11.3.6 and 11.4.0). Further investigation is needed to pinpoint the root cause and potential solutions.

related_issues.title: Pieces crash when on Chrome tab with a lot of content

### Checked for Existing Issues?

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

2. Open a tab with a large amount of content. In my case, it was a GitLab CI job with a 6k line job log. I also experienced crashes with ArgoCD when having 100+ apps on a page.
3. Both Pieces OS and Pieces for Developers crash. There are no corresponding log records in the Support directory, only logs about application startup.

Sometimes it freezes Chrome completely.

I have 16GB RAM, 12 vCPU, and have never experienced such behavior without Pieces.

recommendations: Investigate LLM code generation issues and ensure LLMs provide complete and correct code.
Address Pieces CLI's LTM feature malfunction.
Fix VS Code extension's copy button endless loading issue.
Investigate and resolve Pieces performance issues (slowdowns and crashes) on macOS and Windows.
Address high CPU usage and fan speeds on macOS.
Resolve crashes on Windows, especially with Chrome tabs containing large amounts of content.
Fix inverted arrow key scrolling in Copilot chat on macOS (4.1.2).
Troubleshoot and fix LTM not working correctly in the Pieces CLI.
Prioritize resolving the most active tickets (716, 710, 713, 718, 714, 712) based on their activity level.
Check system resources, update Pieces to the latest version, and review logs for errors to identify root causes and solutions for reported issues.
Gather more user data, including logs, code snippets, and reproduction steps, to aid in debugging and resolution.
Improve communication with users regarding ongoing investigations and resolutions for reported issues.
Consider implementing automated testing to catch issues like the copy button and LTM functionality before they reach users.
Monitor performance across different operating systems and Pieces versions to identify and address platform-specific issues proactively.
Allocate resources to address the most frequent issues, such as Pieces software bugs, performance problems, and crashes across platforms.
Create a dedicated internal tracking system for common issues to monitor their frequency, related issues, and resolution progress.
Develop a knowledge base or FAQ section to address common user questions and issues, reducing support ticket volume.
Implement performance monitoring and alerting to proactively identify and address performance issues before they significantly impact users.
Investigate potential memory leaks or other resource-intensive operations that may be contributing to high CPU/GPU usage and slow performance on macOS.
Optimize Pieces for better performance, especially when handling large amounts of content in Chrome tabs or other resource-intensive scenarios.
Consider adding more detailed logging to Pieces to aid in debugging and troubleshooting complex issues.
Improve error handling and reporting to provide users with more informative error messages and facilitate faster resolution.
Prioritize bug fixes and performance improvements based on the impact on users and the frequency of occurrence.
Regularly test Pieces across different platforms and configurations to ensure compatibility and identify potential issues early on.
Encourage users to report issues through a dedicated channel and provide clear instructions on how to submit helpful bug reports.
Analyze user feedback and support tickets to identify areas for improvement in the software and support operations.
Implement a system for prioritizing and categorizing support tickets to ensure timely resolution of critical issues.
Train support staff on common issues and troubleshooting steps to improve their efficiency and effectiveness.
Regularly review and update support documentation and resources to ensure they are accurate and up-to-date.
Consider using a customer support platform to manage support tickets, track progress, and analyze trends.
Proactively monitor social media and online forums for user feedback and potential issues.
Establish a process for escalating complex issues to the development team and tracking their resolution.
Communicate regularly with users about planned updates and bug fixes to manage expectations and build trust.
Continuously evaluate and improve support operations based on user feedback and performance metrics.
Foster a culture of continuous improvement within the support team to encourage proactive problem-solving and innovation.
Invest in tools and resources to automate repetitive tasks and free up support staff to focus on more complex issues.
Develop a clear escalation path for critical issues to ensure they are addressed quickly and efficiently.
Establish service level agreements (SLAs) for support response times to manage user expectations and ensure accountability.
Regularly review and analyze support metrics, such as ticket volume, resolution time, and customer satisfaction, to identify areas for improvement.
Use data-driven insights to inform decisions about resource allocation and prioritization within the support team.
Implement a feedback loop to gather user feedback on the support experience and identify areas for improvement.
Encourage collaboration between the support team and the development team to improve communication and facilitate faster resolution of issues.
Promote self-service resources, such as FAQs and knowledge bases, to empower users to resolve common issues on their own.
Provide support staff with access to the necessary tools and information to effectively diagnose and resolve user issues.
Create a positive and supportive work environment for the support team to foster high morale and motivation.
Recognize and reward outstanding performance within the support team to encourage excellence and dedication.
Invest in training and development opportunities for support staff to enhance their skills and knowledge.
Empower support staff to take ownership of issues and make decisions to resolve them efficiently.
Foster a culture of customer-centricity within the support team to ensure that user needs are always prioritized.
Continuously seek ways to improve the support experience and exceed user expectations.
Use customer feedback to drive improvements in the product and support operations.
Build strong relationships with users to foster loyalty and advocacy.
Communicate proactively with users about known issues and planned maintenance.
Provide regular updates on the status of reported issues to keep users informed.
Be transparent and honest with users about challenges and limitations.
Empathize with users and acknowledge their frustrations.
Offer alternative solutions or workarounds when possible.
Follow up with users after an issue is resolved to ensure their satisfaction.
Strive to create a seamless and positive support experience for every user.
Use data and analytics to identify trends and patterns in user issues.
Proactively address recurring issues to prevent them from impacting other users.
Continuously monitor and evaluate the effectiveness of support operations.
Adapt and evolve support strategies based on changing user needs and feedback.
Prioritize user experience and satisfaction in all support interactions.
Build a strong reputation for providing excellent customer support.
View support as an opportunity to build relationships and improve the product.
Empower users to become advocates for the product and the company.
Create a community forum or online platform for users to connect and share information.
Encourage users to provide feedback and suggestions for improvement.
Use user feedback to inform product development and roadmap decisions.
Continuously innovate and improve support operations to stay ahead of the curve.
Strive to provide world-class customer support that exceeds user expectations.
